main event: An oval bright silver object the size of a dime was observed for 1-2 minutes over Garden City, New York on October 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was lost from ground-radar for several minutes,The sighting was conducted by a housewife,The observation included ground-radar and air-visual types,The object was reported to possibly be a balloon or aircraft,The observation course was noted as straight with a circular motion southwest of the sighting point.
